citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
*** A whooper swan was being picked on by the other swans this spring and its left eye that had been previously injured
years ago, was again negatively impacted by the aggressive con specifics. The swan has been observed squinting the
eye with some drainage present. The facility has not communicated the swan’s condition to the AV who oversees the
birds at the facility and has been regularly flushing the eye and administering penicillin. As this care has gone on for
months, the AV must be communicated with about the continued condition of the eye for diagnosis and treatment options.
This communication is required to ensure the AV has adequate authority over the medical care of the birds.
*** A male zebra “Zander” was observed favoring and non weight bearing on his right front hoof. The facility stated that
the zebra has had occasional bouts of limping on this leg and was informed to just “watch and observe” the animal in the
past. The AV had not been contacted with this latest bout of lameness. Due to the recurrence of lameness on this leg and
hoof, timely communication is required so that accurate information can be conveyed so the AV can determine next steps
for potential diagnosis and treatment options.
Per this regulation, the facility must establish a mechanism of direct and frequent communication to provide timely and
accurate information on problems of animal health and behavior to the attending veterinarian.

The facility still does not have a written plan to provide for the humane care and handling of animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster. Per this requirement, the plan must include identifying potential emergencies, outlining specific
responses and tasks, establishing a clear chain of command, and identifying emergency resources. This plan should be
maintained at the facility for APHIS inspections and reviewed annually.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility still does not have an environmental enhancement plan in place to promote the overall psychological well-
being of the birds at the facility. Exhibitors must develop, document and follow a species appropriate plan for the
environmental enhancement to promote the psychological well-being of the avian species maintained at the facility that is
within industry standards and in consultation with the attending veterinarian. This plan must be made available for future
inspections.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
